page.title: 18STANDING STONES IN EDAY
page.content: Among the many archaeological sites on Eday, are a few standing stones. One of these is above the Burn of Mussetter. It is situated on the high saddle that separates the valley of Mussetter from the Skaill area. This standing stone is a pointed one which is said to have been thrown down and re-erected some years before 1928. It is now leaning to the north east. It is about 3.2m long and measures o.7m by o.1m at ground level. No-one knows why these stones were erected,the origins are lost in the mist of time.
